definition.en: Physical facilities aimed at exchanging data.

usage.en: E.g. servers, cables, modems.

definition.en: Information column of a Hoppinpoint.

usage.en:
Intended to indicate that a Transport hub is a Hoppin point and/or to inform about the transport possibilities offered there.
More info can be found in the implementation model: https://wegenenverkeer.data.vlaanderen.be/doc/implementatiemodel/hoppinpunten/

definition.en: Transport hub of the mobility brand Hoppin.

usage.en: Hoppin is the name under which the Flemish government indicates transport hubs for passenger transport that meet fixed (quality) requirements. Important aspects are recognisability (application of the Hoppin house style), accessibility (for all users irrespective of disability, age, etc.), minimum equipment (e.g. bicycle sheds, information supports, etc.), alignment with mobility plans, etc.

definition.en: Panel or board or similar infrastructure on which information is displayed.

usage.en: Intended as a means of communication, usually used in public spaces to inform passers-by. Both static carriers such as information boards with a city map and dynamic systems with e.g. public transport departure times are possible.

definition.en: Passenger Transport Hub recognised as such.

usage.en: This recognition implies that a Transport Node is formally designated as a Transport Node. Typically, this is done by the government to give the node an official character (recognisable for the user, meets imposed quality requirements...).

definition.en: A summary of resources connected to mobility services based on defined filters by the person requesting the report.

usage.en: E.g. The number of available bikes at the trainstation.

definition.en: Place where passengers and/or freight are exchanged between vehicles and/or modes of transport.

usage.en: Examples for passenger transport are train stations, underground stations, bus stations, airports, ferry terminals, car parks... For freight transport it concerns typically airports, seaports, transhipment terminals. Transport nodes are typically intermodal, e.g. travellers combine the (shared) bicycle with the train for their trip, but intramodal transfers (e.g. from one bus line to another) are also important. Concretely, a Transport interchange includes infrastructure (stations, car parks, charging infrastructure... ), (mobility) services (public transport lines, shared bicycles, shops... ) and nodes in transport networks (public transport stops, car sharing points... ).

definition.en: Clusters of municipalities in which mobility is coordinated.
Transport node that is dynamically created.

usage.en: The place where a Trip is started usually does not coincide with an existing Transport node, for example it is the home of the Traveller located between two intersections. To still enter the network to start his Trip, the Traveller creates a Virtual Node on the link between these intersections. Virtual Nodes are important for a correct estimation of the travel time e.g. for route planning because the distance between the Virtual Node and the next real Transport Node must be added. Also important for example in free-floating partial transport where the position of the partial step does not necessarily coincide with that of an existing Transport Node.

definition.en: Displays the vehicle types to which the capacity is linked.
State of a Resource.

usage.en: E.g. reserved, inactive, available. Determines whether a resource can be used.

definition.en: The specification of the registered Passenger Transport Hub.
The MobilityService used within the ResourceReport
The road authority of the Passenger Transport Hub.
The number of resources
The location of the Passenger Transport Hub.
Location of the Resource.

usage.en: This could be the real-time location of the vehicle, e.g. in free-floating part transport.

definition.en: The brand of the Passenger Transport Hub.

usage.en: Example: Hoppinpoint, Mobipoint,...

definition.en: Engine of the means of transport.
The accessibility of the Passenger Transport Hub.
The status of the Passenger Transport Hub.
The classification of the Passenger Transport Hub.
The type of means of transport of the Resource.

usage.en: Especially relevant if the resource is a vehicle.

definition.en: The status of the Hoppinpoint
The classification of the Hoppinpoint
More or less defined period of time.

usage.en: Typically, the duration follows from the specification of the start and end time.

definition.en: An organisation that, according to a legal framework, belongs to the public sector, regardless of the level of government at which that framework applies.

usage.en: The public and semi-public organisations that may be considered as belonging to the public sector are referred to in European Directive 2003/98/EC as "public sector bodies" and defined as: "the State, regional or local authorities, bodies governed by public law, associations formed by one or several of such authorities or one or several of such bodies governed by public law". And a body governed by public law is defined as "any body (a) established for the specific purpose of meeting needs in the general interest, not having an industrial or commercial character, and (b) having legal personality, and (c) financed, for the most part, by the State, or regional or local authorities, or other bodies governed by public law; or subject to management supervision by those bodies; or having an administrative, managerial or supervisory board, more than half of whose members are appointed by the State, regional or local authorities or by other bodies governed by public law".

definition.en: A system that provides one or more functions.

usage.en: A full description can be found in OSLO Service

definition.en: Someone or something who can act or produce an effect.
A spatial area or named place.
Set of formal documents describing rules, rights, obligations towards citizens, authorities, companies, etc.

usage.en: The documents in question are laws, policies, regulations, contracts, etc.

definition.en: Parking garage with an automated parking system that automatically parks vehicles in an available space.
Building or structure used for parking bicycles.
Capacity of a civil structure.
An object that provides electrical energy for charging electric vehicles.
A facility used for parking vehicles.
A building intended for parking vehicles.
A parking area located in the open air.
Parking garage that is located below the ground surface.
A place provided for parking one vehicle.
Information like email, telephone, address that makes it possible to contact someone or something.

usage.en: E.g. a person or organisation or a service... Possible forms of contact: calling, e-mailing etc. More detailed description in the AP OSLO-Generic.

definition.en: A 0-dimensional geometric object that represents a particular location in a coordinate space. Has an x-coordinate and a y-coordinate. Can also have a z-coordinate (height) and an m-coordinate (distance along a curve).
Surface consisting of 1 outer boundary and 0 or more inner boundaries. Each internal boundary forms a hole in the polygon.

usage.en: The boundaries are so-called linear rings, i.e. they are closed (not even intersecting) line strings. The outer boundary is distinguished from the inner boundary by the clockwise and counterclockwise directions in which the ring runs, respectively.

definition.en: Name assigned to or used for a geographical object.

usage.en: To be implemented as Langstring.

definition.en: Combination of a string and the language its contents are in.

usage.en: E.g. 'Rue Mercator' as a string and 'fr' as a language. Implementable as Langstring.

definition.en: The type of  Passenger Transport Hub.
The brand type belonging to the Passenger Transport Hub.

usage.en: E.g. Hoppinpoint, Mobipoint

definition.en: TODO
The status of the Passenger Transport Hub.
The status of a Hoppinpoint.

usage.en: E.g. Planned, in progress, operationally active, operationally inactive

definition.en: The type of information column.

usage.en: E.g.: analogue, digital

definition.en: To Do
The type of charger.

usage.en: E.g. fast charger

definition.en: Aard van een Dienstverlening.
The type of infrastructure element.
TODO
TODO
State of a Resource.
The type of plug belonging to the charger.
The different modes of transport available that are shown on the corresponding map.

usage.en: https://wegenenverkeer.data.vlaanderen.be/ns/abstracten#Hoppinzuil.weergegevenVervoersmodiOpKaart

definition.en: To Do
Displays the vehicle types to which the capacity is linked.

The feature type of the parking facility.

usage.en: E.g. Kiss and Ride

definition.en: The feature type of the parking space.

usage.en: E.g. Parking space for disabled persons

definition.en: Displays the types of services that are additional and supportive.

usage.en: E.g. sanitary facilities, cash dispenser, package dispenser, rubbish collection point, charging point...

definition.en: The type of Hoppinpoint.
Information used to uniquely identify an object.

usage.en: The starting point here is that this string is allocated by an organisation and that this is done according to a well-defined system. More detailed description in the AP OSLO-Generic.

definition.en: More readable representation with only the basic data of the address, intended to use an address as attribute of another object.
Shape and position characteristics of an object.

usage.en: Describes these features using points, lines, polygons and coordinates.

definition.en: A location can be an identifiable geographical location (ISO 19112), but this location can also be a non-geographical location, such as a directory, row or column. As such, there are numerous ways in which location can be expressed, such as d

usage.en: To be used if the way in which the geographical position is indicated will only be determined during implementation. If this method is already known, Geometry, GeographicalName, Address etc. should be used immediately.

definition.en: ( Pole-mounted and permanently anchored) signs along the public highway with all kinds of announcements, commercial or otherwise, to be posted on them.

usage.en: Mainly for the purpose of disseminating information (street plan, info board municipality ...). To GRB skeleton detail - WPI12: Pole sign publicity.

definition.en: Service that complements or supports other Services.

usage.en: E.g. Newspaper shop, Postal service or Restaurant in a Station. Services that are supplemented or supported by this are e.g. Mobility Services.

definition.en: Degree to which something can be accessed.

usage.en: E.g. physical accessibility of a service or building for people with disabilities.

definition.en: Degree to which something is available for use.

usage.en: E.g. hours when a service is offered or opening hours of a building.

definition.en: Agent performing mobility service.
Formal authorisation to offer a Mobility Service.
Service that enables movement of Persons between Locations.

usage.en: This includes classical mobility services such as public transport (typically offered as a scheduled service, e.g. Metro Line 5 in Brussels), but also partial transport such as free-floating partial steps (e.g. partial steps in large cities).

definition.en: Registered Organisation providing Mobility Services.

usage.en: By a registered organisation, we mean an organisation with a legal status (established through registration), e.g. LC, NPO...

definition.en: Means that the Mobility Service can offer to the Traveller to make the trip.

usage.en: E.g. a seat on a train, a shared bicycle at a station, a parking space in a car park.

definition.en: Possible, chosen or travelled route between two Locations (respectively the departure point and the arrival point).
Description of a route.

usage.en: Typically the description as it would be shown in a Route Planner.

definition.en: Significant position in the Route that always coincides with the beginning or the end of a Route segment.
Software that can calculate the Route of a Trip.
Part of a Route that is travelled without a transfer using the same means of transport.
Planning in time and space of a service.
Logical connection between two Route nodes.

usage.en: Means to describe the transition between two Route segments if not represented by a Route segment itself. One can interchange between two same Route nodes (e.g. changing from one train to another at the same station) or between two different ones (e.g. interchanging from the station car parking to the station platforms).

definition.en: Logical connection between two or more Transport objects in different Transport Networks.
Person who undertakes or wants to undertake a Trip.
Link in either its positive or negative direction.
Significant position in the Network that always coincides with the beginning or the end of a Link.

usage.en: A full description can be found in OSLO Network

definition.en: Collection of Network elements.

usage.en: The reason why the Network elements are brought together in a Network can differ, e.g. because they are suitable for a certain type of transport. A full description can be found in OSLO Network.

definition.en: Element in a Network that performs a function of importance within it.

usage.en: A full description can be found in OSLO Network

definition.en: Separately identifiable element that is either directly or indirectly attached to the surface of the earth.

usage.en: A full description can be found in OSLO Public Domain

definition.en: As a rule, a bus shelter provides accommodation for public transport passengers.

usage.en: To GRB base - WGA1: Bus shelter

definition.en: A bicycle parking facility is the aggregate of poles and/or anchorage points of a structure intended for securing bicycles, located in the public domain.

usage.en: To GRB skeleton addition detail - WPI16: Bicycle storage. With the attribute covered as True: GRB base - WGA3: Covered bicycle shed.

definition.en: A stop post indicates the location where public transport, e.g. bus, tram or trolley, stops to allow passengers to board or alight.

usage.en: Towards GRB skeletonisation detail - WPI1102 road signage public transport

definition.en: Individual object on the Public Domain that is not vegetative.
Street furniture is a diverse group of objects that generally stand in public space (both corridor and surplus area)

usage.en: A full description can be found in OSLO Public Domain - Infrastructure Elements

definition.en: Significant position in the Transport Network that always coincides with the beginning or the end of a Transport Link.
Collection of Network elements representing the same mode of transport.

usage.en: The transport mode is at least road, rail, air and water. Further subdivision into Transport Networks according to means of transport, drive type, service type is possible.

definition.en: Element in a Transport network that performs a function of importance therein.
A place such as a platform, bus stop, stand or train platform where passengers can access public transport vehicles, taxis, cars or other means of transport.
A stopping point represents a station, stop, port, airport or any other physical access point to the transport network.
An abstract type describing a place

usage.en: A full description can be found in OSLO Mobility - Timetable and Planning - Stopplaces

definition.en: A civic structure, such as a town hall or a concert hall

usage.en: A full description can be found in schema.org

definition.en: A monetary value or range.
Price of the Trips that can be made with the Mobility Service.

usage.en: Allows to find out how much a specific Journey will cost, taking into account e.g. the distance travelled or how long the Mobility Service is used. Including any discounts for target groups e.g. discount for children under 12 years.

definition.en: Voluntary movement of a Person from one Location to another Location.

usage.en: The trip may take place via other Locations. The Location where the trip starts can be the same as where the trip ends (e.g. round trip).

definition.en: The hours at which a service or contact is available.
Unique identification number given to each column and included in the Passenger Transport Hub database.
Name of the hoppinpoint that refers to a clear and recognisable place name.
The different modes of transport available are shown on the corresponding map.
Hours on which something is available

usage.en: Syntax according to schema.org for opening hours. E.g. if contact can be made between 8 and 20h Monday to Saturday and between 8 and 18h on Sunday this is coded as Mon-Sat 08:00-20:00, Sun 08:00-18:00.

definition.en: Time at which the Trip ends or at which the Passenger would like it to end.

usage.en: Usually only a departure or arrival time is given.

definition.en: Sequence of Locations to be visited during the Trip.

usage.en: Usually only a departure or arrival time is specified

definition.en: The platform belonging to the stop
The platform as part of the stopping point.
The transport node to which the Mobility Service is linked.
The additional services associated with the transport object
The additional services connected to the Passenger Transport Hub.
The transport nodes to which this transport object belongs.
Infrastructure element on which the Mobility Service is available

usage.en: E.g. public transport such as buses are offered at a bus stop.

definition.en: The main transport mode of the stopping point.
The type of stopping point
Address of a numbered building on a named road.
Code used to identify a stopping point to the public as an alternative to a name.
Use to identify the platform to the public.
Polygon associated with the stopping point.
Categorisation of the stopping point.
Parent site containing this stop.
Centre of the stopping point.
Access modes by which the stopping point can be accessed.
Name of the Transport object.
Name of the Transport network.
The transport object of the Passenger Transport Hub.
Transport network to which the transport object belongs.
The infrastructure elements connected to the transport object.
The infrastructure element of the Passenger Transport Hub.
Network elements connected by the Connection.
Indicates whether the direction of the link corresponds to its positive or negative direction.
Identifier of the Transport node.
Location of the Transport node.
Node where the Route Segment starts.
Trip that a Traveller undertakes or wants to undertake.
Time in which the Route is traveled.

usage.en: Inferred from other features of the Route, e.g. the route segments that make up the Route and their characteristics.

definition.en: Public organisation responsible for traffic management or the planning, control or management of a particular transport network or mode of transport, or both, that falls under its territorial competence.
Time in which the changeover takes place.
Route node to which it will be switched.
Schedule of times when something is offered.
State of a Resource.

usage.en: E.g. reserved, inactive, available. Determines whether a resource can be used.

definition.en: Description of the Route.

usage.en: Inferred from other features of the Route, e.g. the route segments that make up the Route and their characteristics.

definition.en: Resource available to the Mobility Service.
Resource of the Mobility Service that the traveller has used in the Route node.

usage.en: E.g. parking space.

definition.en: Mobility service used by the Traveller in the Route node.

usage.en: E.g. parking.

definition.en: Mobility Service which the Traveller has used in travelling the Route Segment.
Transport object with which the Route connection coincides.

usage.en: E.g. the stop where one changes between two metro lines, the address where one changes between two modes of transport.

definition.en: Name of the Traveler which differs from his actual name.

usage.en: The aim is that the real identity of the Traveller can no longer be traced but that trip data can still be studied on an individual level.

definition.en: The Mobility Service provider.
Price plan of the Mobility Service.
Routes that can be followed to perform the Trip.
Type of user to which the availability applies.
Executor of the Mobility Service.

usage.en: May differ from the Provider.

definition.en: More specific Mobility Services that make up the Mobility Service.

usage.en: For example, public transport in Brussels offered by STIB consists of a number of metro lines, e.g. line 5 Erasmus-Herman-Debroux, or a MAAS provider integrates several services, e.g. public transport and shared transport.

definition.en: Formal Framework within which the Mobility Service is offered.

usage.en: E.g. Decree listing the criteria for authorising a Mobility Service.

definition.en: Location of the Resource.

usage.en: This could be the real-time location of the vehicle, e.g. in free-floating part transport.

definition.en: License under which the Mobility Service is offered.
Level of accessibility.
Traveller who accompanies the Traveller on the Journey.

usage.en: E.g. the children of a family travelling together. Important e.g. when determining the price of a Ticket when young children travel free of charge.

definition.en: Identifier of the Resource.

usage.en: E.g. number plate of the hire car, number of the seat...

definition.en: Route finally implemented to realise the Trip.

usage.en: Actual time of arrival and departure, duration of journey, etc.

definition.en: The mobility services connected to the Passenger Transport Hub.
The mobility services connected to the transport object.
Location where the Route starts.
Cost price of the route.

usage.en: E.g. the sum of the cost of the purchased Tickets.

definition.en: Part of the service or infrastructure to which Accessibility relates.
Route which the Passenger chooses from the possible Routes.

usage.en: Possibly more than 1 selected Route if the traveller changes Route on the way.

definition.en: Method of calculating the route.
Transport object on which the Mobility Service is offered.

usage.en: E.g. P+R is offered in station parking, shared bicycle + train in combination point.

definition.en: Location where the Route ends.
Propulsion of the means of transport with or for which the Mobility Service is usually organised.
Propulsion of the means of transport by which the route segment was covered.
Propulsion of the means of transport by which the Transfer is made.
Engine of the means of transport.
Node where the route segment ends.
Accessibility of the Transport object.

usage.en: E.g. whether the Transport object is accessible for persons with a disability.

definition.en: The overall accessibility characteristics of the infrastructure element.
The overall accessibility characteristics of the stopping point.
Availability of the Transport object.

usage.en: E.g. opening hours

definition.en: Referentie naar verbonden klasse.
Referentie naar verbonden klasse.
Type of means of transport the route segment was covered with.
Sequence of Directed Links that make up the Route Segment.
Resource of the Mobility Service used by the Traveller when travelling the Route Segment.
Time when the Route starts.
Sequence of Route Segments that make up the Route.
Time at which the Route ends.
Means of transport by which the Transfer is made.

usage.en: Usually on foot.

definition.en: Means of transport by which or for which the Mobility Service is usually organised.

usage.en: E.g. metro, tram, bus for STIB. E.g. car, bicycle for parking Coovi.

definition.en: The type of means of transport of the Resource.

usage.en: Especially relevant if the resource is a vehicle.

definition.en: Accessibility of the Mobility Service.

usage.en: E.g. whether the Mobility Service is accessible to persons with disabilities.

definition.en: Availability of the Mobility Service.

usage.en: E.g. timetable or opening hours.

definition.en: Period in which something is available.

usage.en: E.g. start date without end date for services that are still active or an indication of the season in which the services are offered. A completed end date indicates when the service was terminated. Start and end date according to ISO8601 syntax.

definition.en: The period during which the current version of the infrastructure element is in use.
The provider of the additional service.
The Passenger Transport Hub at which the additional service is offered.
Accessibility of the additional service.

usage.en: E.g. whether the Mobility Service is accessible to persons with disabilities.

definition.en: Availability of the additional service.

usage.en: E.g. timetable or opening hours.

definition.en: Transport object on which the additional service is offered.
Infrastructure element on which the additional service is offered.
Country where the address is located in.
Municipality name of the address.
Alphanumeric code officially assigned to building units, moorings, standing places or parcels.
Officially assigned alphanumeric code added to the house number to distinguish several building units, standing places, moorings or parcels sharing the same house number.
Identifier obtained by the organisation upon registration.

usage.en: In the CBE, this is the enterprise number.

definition.en: The registration of the executor.

usage.en: In the CBE, this is the enterprise number.

definition.en: Street name of the address.
Code designating the geographical area that groups addresses for postal purposes.
Location of the Route node.
Geometry of the place or area.
The geometry corresponding to the infrastructure element.
Geometry of the place or area.
The registration of the registered Passenger Transport Hub.
Identifier of the Transport connection
The identifier of the infrastructure element.
Name preferred by the Organisation.
Name by which the performer is preferably identified.
Name of the town or area.
Name of the town or area.
Geometry expressed in wkt-format.

usage.en: Use http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#wktLiteral as datatype.

definition.en: Geometry expressed in gml-format.

usage.en: Use http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#gmlLiteral as datatype.

definition.en: Part of a complete Trip that can also be considered a Trip in itself.
Sequence of Locations to be visited during the Trip.

usage.en: Including the Location where the Journey starts and ends.

definition.en: Information such as email, telephone... which allows the Organisation to be contacted.
Information such as e-mail, telephone... which allows the executor to be contacted.
Indicates the capacity of a resource.
The type of charger.
Part of the charger used to form the connection with the electric vehicles.
The parking space of the parking facility.
Indicates the maximal value of the capacity.
The opening hours of the parking facility.
The features of the parking facility.

usage.en: E.g. kiss-and-ride zone, loading and unloading zone

definition.en: The features of the car park

usage.en: E.g. parking for people with disabilities

definition.en: The exit of the parking facility.
The entrance of the parking facility.
The capacity of the parking facility.
Means of transport that is electrically powered.
Type of information column
Nature of the Transport Node
Nature of the Transport connection
Nature of the Mobility Service.

usage.en: E.g. public transport, parking etc. Combinations are possible, e.g. collective transport & public transport (e.g. SNCB), individual transport & private transport (taxis)

definition.en: Nature of the Route

usage.en: E.g. shortest, fastest

definition.en: Nature of the Route node
Nature of the Resource.
Nature of the accessibility
The type of infrastructure element.
Nature of the transport network according to the mode of transport.
Nature of the additional service.

usage.en: E.g. ticketing, waiting facilities, sanitary facilities, AED...

definition.en: Nature of the Resource.
The name of the Passenger Transport Hub.
Name of the Mobility Service.
Name of the Price specfication
Name of the formal framework.
Name of the Route planner
Name of the additional service.
Area or Place within which the Mobility Service is offered.

usage.en: E.g. Brussels Region, Antwerp...

definition.en: Administrative area covering the Public Organisation.
Description of the Price specification.
Description of the formal framework.
Period for which the Licence is valid.
The stopping point as a larger entity to which the platform belongs.
Area or Place in which the Licence is valid.
The geographical scope of the formal framework.

usage.en: In other words, whether it is European, national or local.

definition.en: Start of the time period.
End of the time period.
